Package ohos.agp.components

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.Image

  • public class Image
extends Component
    Indicates a component that displays images.

    Image inherits from Component and is used to display image resources.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Image.ScaleMode
      Indicates the scaling mode of images.

    • Method Detail

      • setPixelMapHolder

        public void setPixelMapHolder​(PixelMapHolder pixelMapHolder)
        Sets a PixelMapHolder object to be displayed for this Image.

        This method can be more efficient than setPixelMap(ohos.media.image.PixelMap) when it is called in a single thread.

        Parameters:
        pixelMapHolder - Indicates the image object.
        Since:
        4

      • setImageAndDecodeBounds

        public void setImageAndDecodeBounds​(int resId)
        Sets the resource ID of the image to be displayed and decodes the image.

        This interface will scale the picture according to the size of the component. Using this interface to set the same resource id on different components may cause some of them to display blurry. Please use this interface with caution.

        Parameters:
        resId - Indicates the resource ID of the image to display.
        Since:
        3

      • setPixelMap

        public void setPixelMap​(int resId)
        Sets the resource ID of an image to display.
        Parameters:
        resId - Indicates the resource ID of the image to display.
        Since:
        3

      • setClipDirection

        public void setClipDirection​(int clipDirection)
        Sets the image clipping direction.

        If the size of an image exceeds that of the component, the image can be clipped horizontally or vertically. Horizontal clipping does not change the vertical contents of the image. Vertical clipping does not change the horizontal contents of the image.

        Parameters:
        clipDirection - Specifies the image clipping direction. 1 indicates CLIP_HORIZONTAL, which is horizontal clipping; 2 indicates CLIP_VERTICAL, which is vertical clipping.
        Since:
        3

      • getClipDirection

        public int getClipDirection​()
        Obtains the image clipping direction.
        Returns:
        Returns the image clipping direction.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setClipDirection(int)

      • setClipGravity

        @Deprecated
public void setClipGravity​(int clipGravity)
        Deprecated. Use setClipAlignment(int) instead.
        Sets the clipping alignment mode.

        This method sets the clipping alignment mode. For example, if the value is GRAVITY_LEFT, the right part of the image will be clipped when the width of the image exceeds that of the component.

        Parameters:
        clipGravity - Specifies the clipping mode by using static consonants in Image, for example, GRAVITY_LEFT.
        Since:
        5

      • getClipGravity

        @Deprecated
public int getClipGravity​()
        Deprecated. Use getClipAlignment() instead.
        Obtains the image clipping alignment mode.
        Returns:
        Returns the image clipping alignment mode.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        setClipGravity(int)

      • setClipAlignment

        public void setClipAlignment​(int clipAlignment)
        Sets the clipping alignment mode.

        This method sets the clipping alignment mode. For example, if the value is GRAVITY_LEFT, the right part of the image will be clipped when the width of the image exceeds that of the component.

        Parameters:
        clipAlignment - Specifies the clipping mode by using static consonants in Image, for example, GRAVITY_LEFT.
        Since:
        5

      • getClipAlignment

        public int getClipAlignment​()
        Obtains the image clipping alignment mode.
        Returns:
        Returns the image clipping alignment mode.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        setClipAlignment(int)

      • setScaleMode

        public void setScaleMode​(Image.ScaleMode scaleMode)
        Sets the scaling mode of an image.

        This method scales or clips an image when the sizes of the image and the component are different. For details of scaling modes, see ScaleMode.

        Parameters:
        scaleMode - Indicates the ScaleMode enumeration value, which specifies the scaling mode.
        Since:
        4

      • getScaleMode

        public Image.ScaleMode getScaleMode​()
        Obtains the image scaling mode.
        Returns:
        Returns the image scaling mode.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        setScaleMode(ScaleMode)

      • setCornerRadius

        public void setCornerRadius​(float radius)
        Sets a uniform radius for the four rounded corners of this Image.
        Parameters:
        radius - Indicates the radius to set. The value of this parameter must be greater than 0. If the value is less than or equal to 0, the setting is invalid.
        Since:
        3

      • getCornerRadius

        public float getCornerRadius​()
        Obtains the corner radius.
        Returns:
        Returns the radius, in floating number.
        Since:
        3

      • setCornerRadii

        public void setCornerRadii​(float[] radii)
        Sets a radius for each rounded corner of this Image.
        Parameters:
        radii - Indicates the array of radii to set.
        Since:
        3
